Moodboosting books for older people

  • The Alchemist by Paulo Coelho
  • All Passion Spent by Vita Sackville-West
  • Attention All Shipping: A Journey Round the Shipping Forecast by Charlie Connelly
  • The Bad Dog’s Diary: A Year in the Life of Blake: Lover… Fighter… Dog by Martin Howard
  • Bird Cloud: A Memoir of Place by Annie Proulx
  • The Builders by Maeve Binchy
  • Call the Midwife by Jennifer Worth
  • Gilead by Marilynne Robinson
  • Let the Great World Spin by Colum McCann
  • A Long Lunch by Simon Hoggart
  • Penguin’s Poems for Life selected by Laura Barber
  • Reading in Bed by Sue Gee
  • Remarkable Creatures by Tracy Chevalier
  • Selected Stories by Anton Chekhov
  • A Short History of Tractors in Ukrainian by Marina Lewycka
  • The Snow Goose and The Small Miracle by Paul Gallico
  • Somewhere Towards the End by Diana Athill
  • A Spot of Bother by Mark Haddon
  • Two Cures for Love: Selected Poems 1979-2006 by Wendy Cope
  • Wildwood: A Journey Through Trees by Roger Deakin

About

My name is Sarah Lungley and I am the coordinator for Suffolk Libraries Mental Health and Wellbeing Information Service. My role is to help provide information on local services and to promote events in our libraries and the community that can support mental health and wellbeing. The service also aims to support our library staff, to ensure they are able to access useful and up-to-date information for our customers should they request it.

Libraries are a fantastic resource, not only for books and information but for community, friendships and fun too. So pop in to your local branch or explore our website to find out more about what we do – we hope to see you soon!
